poem.title: Snapshot
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
If she'd asked him to dance He couldn't have been more Ungainly. Freeze and say cheese! Stick em up and relax! Then there's her, in cahoots with the camera Make a wish.
The wings on this big boeing Twang in the winch of inconvenient Weather. The usual voltage runs A torch of shadows By which I pick my way.
